description.value:
Trigger A creature tries to unlock or Pick the Lock

Effect The trap deals the triggering creature @Damage[(2d10+11)[mental]] damage (nonlethal) (@Check[will|dc:30|basic] save) and @Damage[1d6[persistent,mental]] damage (nonlethal). A creature that fails their save is additionally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Paralyzed] for as long as they suffer the persistent mental damage.

details.description: Magical symbols carved in the doorframe magically ward this door; anyone attempting to pick the lock is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Paralyzed] and wracked with pain. Disabling or breaking the trap does not disable or break the lock.
details.disable:
@Check[thievery|dc:28] (expert) to scratch out the magical symbols, @Check[arcana|dc:28] (expert) to safely siphon the magical energy, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dispel Magic] (4th rank; counteract DC 26)

Bypass Anyone other than Mirida turns the door handle three times to the right and once to the left in quick succession.

publication.title: Pathfinder #215: To Blot Out the Sun

details.reset: The trap automatically resets. It doesn't reset if the trap is disabled.
